title: Hyperbranched TEMPO-based polymers as catholytes for redox flow battery applications
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,32893-32910
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA03925D, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Koosha Ehtiati, Ilya Anufriev, Christian Friebe, Ivan A. Volodin, Christian Stolze, Simon Muench, Grit Festag, Ivo Nischang, Martin D. Hager, Ulrich S. Schubert
Hyperbranched TEMPO-based polymers are investigated as catholytes for redox flow batteries revealing relatively low viscosity, rapid diffusion, and fast charge transfer. Remaining challenges are the polymers being prone to crossover and having a low cycling stability.
